intro: Sida emilei, commonly known as Emile's mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats. Sida emilei is also noted for its ability to tolerate drought conditions.
